page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT
page.content: BOGSIDE MINE.It was sunk in the late 1950's. At that time it was producing fifteen thousand tons of coal each week. At this time nine hundred men were employed. Unfortunately on January, 27th, 1984 the mine was flooded. After this seven hundred men were transferred to many other mines.On March, 12th, 1984 a nation wide strike took place by mine workers. The one hundred and fifty men left at Bogside went on strike. The strike lasted over a year. Now only a skeleton staff is left, about forty three men. They are mainly occupied with maintenance and salvage. No one at the moment, however, has told the staff to completely brick up the mine. A change in political attitude could perhaps change the future of the mine although it would need tremendous capital investment.
